title: RecursionError: maximum recursion depth exceeded while calling a Python object when train.py in Kaggle kernel with wandb disabled
body:
Hello, and Thanks for this fabulous yolo package. 

I was testing yolo v3 in Kaggle kernel with kaggle instruction notebook in [https://www.kaggle.com/ultralytics/yolov3](https://www.kaggle.com/ultralytics/yolov3)

But with wandb disabled setting, it gives the following error message during training. 

!python train.py --img 640 --batch 16 --epochs 3 --data coco128.yaml --weights yolov3.pt --nosave --cache
#############################################
github: up to date with https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3 
2021-05-12 03:38:09.764707: I tensorflow/stream_executor/platform/default/dso_loader.cc:48] Successfully opened dynamic library libcudart.so.10.2
2021-05-12 03:38:10.008276: I tensorflow/stream_executor/platform/default/dso_loader.cc:48] Successfully opened dynamic library libcudart.so.10.2
train: Scanning '../coco128/labels/train2017' images and labels... 128 found, 0 
train: Caching images (0.1GB): 100%|█████████| 128/128 [00:00<00:00, 195.79it/s]
val: Scanning '../coco128/labels/train2017.cache' images and labels... 128 found
val: Caching images (0.1GB): 100%|███████████| 128/128 [00:00<00:00, 139.70it/s]
Plotting labels... 
autoanchor: Analyzing anchors... anchors/target = 4.26, Best Possible Recall (BPR) = 0.9946
       0/2      9.3G   0.02899   0.02444  0.007403   0.06083       161       640
               Class      Images      Labels           P           R      mAP@.5
                 all         128         929       0.738       0.738        0.79        0.56
       1/2     9.08G   0.02946   0.02422  0.007518    0.0612       182       640
               Class      Images      Labels           P           R      mAP@.5
                 all         128         929       0.748       0.722       0.792        0.56
       2/2     12.2G   0.02799   0.02146  0.007992   0.05744       188       640
               Class      Images      Labels           P           R      mAP@.5
                 all         128         929       0.761       0.716        0.79       0.556
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "train.py", line 543, in <module>
    train(hyp, opt, device, tb_writer)
  File "train.py", line 402, in train
    torch.save(ckpt, last)
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/site-packages/torch/serialization.py", line 372, in save
    _save(obj, opened_zipfile, pickle_module, pickle_protocol)
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/site-packages/torch/serialization.py", line 476, in _save
    pickler.dump(obj)
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/site-packages/wandb/dummy.py", line 129, in __getattr__
    return self[attr]
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/site-packages/wandb/dummy.py", line 135, in __getitem__
    dummy = Dummy()
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/site-packages/wandb/dummy.py", line 6, in __init__
    object.__setattr__(self, "___dict", {})
RecursionError: maximum recursion depth exceeded while calling a Python object
add Codeadd Markdown
################################################
It seems like this error had already been treated in https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/issues/1575

Currently Kaggle has changed its kernel notebook interface. Maybe this error is because of it.  Colab kernel works fine. 

One thing to add, when I set wandb login with kaggle notebook, it doesn't show up input box for pasting wandb API credential keys. Any idea to correct this? 

![no_input_box](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55954384/117917902-ff65fa80-b324-11eb-9abc-1e7a29f8d759.png)

Best regards.
